title: Experience the Best of Tenerife Island with the Tour Guide
text:
Travel Articles | August 14, 2015 
Tenerife is one of the Canary Islands which belong to Spain. Tenerife is the largest island at 2034 sq km and also the highest at 3718 m. The highest point is the Mount Teide which is also Spain’s highest mountain 
Tenerife is therefore, undoubtedly the best island to be in. The islands are however located just off the coast of Africa. There are many reasons why Tenerife is a popular destination and a lovely place for holidaymakers from all over the world. Tenerife Holiday Guide - Canary Islands is you best partner when it comes to exploring some of the best sceneries on the islands. 
The Thrill of Tenerife 
It is an island with a real 'north-south' experience as you get all the fun across that divides in more than one way. Tenerife information and tourist Guide, Canary Islands tells you more about the party animals who often head south for the sizzling beaches. The island has the hottest nightlife compared to the others in the Canary Islands. As you take it easy in the sun you can also enjoy the parties and your best drinks on the beaches. The best resorts of Los Cristianos and Playa de las Americas provide the best nightlife on the island. Puerto de la Cruz is just a lasher, cooler, quieter and popular for the older crowd. Here you will get beaches, golf courses, theme parks, yacht marinas and conference centers. The island offers a complete set of leisure and fun activities for satisfaction of all kinds of tastes. 
Beaches 
There are so many beaches in Tenerife Island. Some of the most popular ones are along the Southern coast. They are in Los Cristianos and Las Americas and they are endowed with grey sand which make them unique. Adjacent to the beaches are hotels and apartments. El Medano is also a perfect beach going up on the east coast. If you need surfing during your visit then include it on your Tenerife Holiday Guide - Canary Islands. The beaches with strong winds are located more to the north. The beach Playa de Las Teresitas also has sand imported from the Sahara. 
Other Sceneries 
The Orotava Valley is an example of the island’s fertility and it extends to the limits of Las Canadas Park located on the western shore of Tenerife Island. Here you will get massive banana plantations as well as orchards. The La Orotava Valley and Tenerife also have many golf courses like the Golf del Sur, Abama Golf Resort and Amarilla Golf and Country Club. The Mt. Teide is also here and is Spain's highest peak as well as the most visited site for tourist attraction. There are cable cars which will take you to the highest point of the volcano. Another popular destination in the Tropic of Cancer which is about 200 miles shy off the North African coastline. 
Sunny Years 
Being in an all-sunny environment all year round is amazing. This is what Tenerife Island offers. As you formulate your Tenerife Holiday Guide - Canary Islands you will not have to restrict your travel to specific times of the year. The island experiences more than 3,000 hours of sunshine all year round. Source: Free Articles from ArticlesFactory.com ABOUT THE AUTHOR 
Should you be looking to have fun, Tenerife Holiday Guide Canary Islands should be your best answer. Part of what tourist like most is a bit of history of their destinations. Tenerife has a rich history ranging from The Spanish Crusades to The Carnival Island. If you basically want to know more about Spain Tenerife, get Tenerife information and tourist Guide, Canary Island because this is the place to be.
